title: English Language Arts: Grade 7
subject: English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

93D59EA788F44251A2F30B365CEF5C4B.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and
phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension
or expression.

0200DBD74ABB4FA49C74E28882BF4DBE.description:
Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions)
(e.g., refined, respectful, polite, diplomatic, condescending).

01C180CDE660499BA6CC2A899DA2EE61.description:
Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., synonym/antonym, analogy) to better
understand each of the words.

B7D5FA1C69F647A6919F5B506E4E0C15.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., literary, biblical, and mythological allusions) in context.

494FA885A3B14CBE91CCCFCC14BFD07B.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

BF495F15DFD44393821423A4A475FB19.description:
Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the
inferred meaning in context or by using other reference materials).

5E0A569EC62640DC9BE0EB127C71B2C1.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses)
to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of
speech.

2E8859609B434E8EAA5E06E801DCC4B5.description:
Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a
word (e.g., belligerent, bellicose, rebel).

1F70B603B025490FB058348E4EB57B93.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function
in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

EB4AFD9C3B2C4E739289E82EE975BC82.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade
7 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

214848AFFBE24ECD96682839764EEDB0.description:
Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating
wordiness and redundancy.

C8980EA5FE6D478984E1C375ADE49438.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

EE8F80E8B4B7462D97D33A2A42BE006C.description: Spell correctly, consulting references as needed.

095349607CAF4AE2883B1F486055F57B.description:
Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but
not He wore an old[,] green shirt).

D8AA7CED78CA497EAA9BD5E803379809.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling
when writing.

89C8C3B0AFC74AAABED23527895D9DED.description:
Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and
dangling modifiers.

FE82E8A2F51D4D0FA87A3E57F054DF68.description:
Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal
differing relationships among ideas.

46A1EF761E7742CDB7BEA67CCB7C634B.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.

C28829FE50244C81AFD46F12CD92CABB.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or
speaking.

5A398B0A6594490780E669FE96D0C0E8.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, such as conducting interviews and participating in
public performances, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate; use
appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation. (See grade 7 Language standards
1 and 3 for specific expectations)

2B9D2174C9914AD1A209635E5EC6BDD3.description:
Integrate multimedia components and visual displays (e.g., graphics, images, charts, graphs) in
presentations to clarify claims and findings and emphasize salient points.

5E80AE09B5B2493F81DBCB97ADF9763F.description:
Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with pertinent
descriptions, facts, details, and examples, and style appropriate to purpose, audience, and task.

9C64DAF9594B4972A1BFD13343A60974.description:
Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and the
relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

2EF85EFDF6ED4D1B8D642ECCAC9D405A.description:
Analyze the main ideas and supporting details presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually,
quantitatively, orally) and explain how the ideas clarify a topic, text, or issue under study.

A0D14C278E114CA8A2646D8B2EFAC307.description:
Acknowledge new information expressed by others and, when warranted, modify their own
views.

92FBE38468954F7382FF7B8C5BF9E9A1.description:
Pose questions that elicit elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments with
relevant observations and ideas that bring the discussion back on topic as needed.

72576F95D6C14931B417FD75CA5FA11E.description:
Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making (e.g., informal consensus, taking
votes on key issues, presentation of alternate views), track progress toward specific goals and
deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

C94DC5C65ECF4099B0443D5C2FAA78A2.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw
on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on
ideas under discussion.

A3E6282DD416449D827BC73D704C58C4.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with
diverse partners on grade 7 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their
own clearly.

43A38484403B49ADABFC9FFC75270F60.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time
frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and
audiences.

B725DAB467194C9089C8C60AB3831138.description:
Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the
argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the
evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims”).

58B34CE4A12749278B278E7CD2FB10AE.description:
Apply grade 7 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal
of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of
understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history”).

DBD1291CDE0E4C89B57703C995662C73.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

C31298D3F0074BC8B6B2101AB466E29E.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating
additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

59A9AF9D1E4140069546B80569462F34.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

BA2C31294F12444DA5CC167479CD98B9.description:
Use technology to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others,
including linking to and citing sources.

39AB0649BD0348B6A4BD4361B957C4E2.description:
With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by
planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and
audience have been addressed. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language
standards 1–3 up to and including grade 7.)

FAAB8A4CBFA345798BFE1A300FA5A0E8.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to
task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–
3 above.)

F72F94065906408F972BECEE3DFF47AE.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on the narrated experiences or events.

CED6BB65E4B6473FA083A1D58E4B8D94.description:
Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture
the action and convey experiences and events.

410C917EFDF94564A65134C20DFBFA84.description:
Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts
from one time frame or setting to another.

2EE8452B01994589A600E91B13D73626.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences,
events, and/or characters.

F2F5B21A43A94E27B03C343B328347A5.description:
Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a
narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

B4DA1E052A4847BBA447292FD74D8A63.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant
descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

869F9B38231049FE8A378B10976BBAAB.description:
Provide a concluding statement or section that follows and supports the information or
explanation presented.

EA519F6E7D6945599F1259C30743854B.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

4826948E0EAA4C49A89F6007ABFC28C6.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

1D1356F9551844F497BCF11213759957.description:
Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and
concepts.

54E2D0377E41462E846A8AA9B36023BA.description:
Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other
information and examples.

08BE9146C8CA4E2197CEF398475AC1F5.description:
Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and
information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and
cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia
when useful to aiding comprehension.

8497CD30F50D4F5EA44C2669FE4594B8.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information
through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

EAD6B8A9C5DF40DAB81E979D3B2E30CA.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows and supports the argument presented.

BDA07C4402C84BC0A49EAF8C697936C6.description: Establish and maintain a tone and style appropriate for the task and audience.

27F3171BB1894FE6B9F4FB7465C160F5.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among
claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

108C52D2072E47F0816CBDBA7A58698F.description:
Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources
and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

34D90650017C46AD86E48AA36B32A45B.description:
Introduce claim(s), acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and
evidence logically.

0B8B29E3641E4EA5A6490B090F002FFF.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

769D1B652F70417EB848977D0488EB28.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction in the grades 6–8 text complexity band
proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

B9FFB6746736453E890C9BB64575D5B6.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

50B9C0774166417889AADA715D440BE1.description:
Analyze how two or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key
information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts.

5A1CFDB709054A569B8A295B2A386E13.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is
sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims.

DD7AA38D74C24037BE758350850F29D4.description:
Compare and contrast a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text, analyzing each
medium’s portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the impact of the words).

21CDECE9B37241F3BBD107C75AD343FC.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author distinguishes his
or her position from that of others.

A7C8A1584F60418682750CEB1EE28D1B.description:
Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to
the whole and to the development of the ideas.

AF5D0D733669410EB13C1DC883EA2410.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative,
connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and
tone.

044582EB89DC446DB1DA163D988818E6.description:
Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in a text (e.g., how ideas influence
individuals or events, or how individuals influence ideas or events).

63D25825F893474DBB397F2B6A195776.description: Provide an objective summary of the text.

AC99C39755BE4D8F8036B774BAFF534C.description:
Determine two or more central ideas in a text and analyze their development throughout the
text.

396C98AB1AEC4C0B9E97EB869F597375.description:
Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as
inferences drawn from the text.

A139107AE9D348D795BA11AE289EE5E5.description:
By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, in the
grades 6–8 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

971AB3D64CC9440FADCC258DC992693D.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

2D652227C6EB4D37AEFE8619E3A6CB15.description:
Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the
same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

99C0792CADD7487389A02FC3B050DD4B.description:
Compare a text to another text in a different medium about the same topic; evaluate the techniques
unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or camera focus and angles in a film) and its impact
on the audience.

645C04B5447E4339ADCDA6BC6AF0379B.description:
Analyze how an author contrasts the points of view and/or perspectives of different characters or
narrators in a text.

377D7414AAE84C9281B2E43D2A3FE941.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text and how it contributes to the text meaning.

7AEB3C13E2EE4257A2E91A8A06263B98.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and
connotative meaning; analyze the impact of specific word choice on meaning, tone and mood, including
words with multiple meanings within a text.

B66FA7680BEB40FE8CCF7544477C353B.description:
Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the characters or
plot).

B82B9E1600DF415EBF6700D8AEB606D1.description: Provide an objective summary of the text.

643A39F123B641E888C656D1326B304C.description:
Determine a theme or central idea of a text; analyze the development of the theme throughout
the text.

F360DEBA3CCC4DA4A340323FFFAFE026.description:
Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as
inferences drawn from the text.
